extra.translation[0].definitions[0].defi: more of something, in addition to the usual or standard amount or number
extra.translation[0].definitions[0].exam: Could you get an extra loaf of bread?
Allow extra time for your journey.
Drivers are advised to take extra care.
Residents can use the gym at no extra cost.
I asked for an extra two weeks to finish the work.
an extra ten minutes/three metres etc
extra.translation[0].definitions[1].defi: if something is extra, it is not included in the price of something and you have to pay more for it
extra.translation[0].definitions[1].exam: Dinner costs $15 but wine is extra.
extra.translation[0].note_box[0].section: extra
in addition to the usual or standard cost, time, amount etc
They let the kids stay up an extra hour.
Some stores charge extra for delivery.
Postage is extra.
additional
more than the basic amount or the amount that you expected or agreed. Additional  is more formal than extra
An evening job would provide additional income.
There may be an additional charge for paying bills by credit card.
added
extra – used when talking about something that makes something better or more effective
an added benefit
an added precaution
It was a beautiful place, and the good weather was an added bonus.
Use a sunscreen for added protection.
spare
kept in addition to the one you usually use, so that it is available if the one you usually use breaks, gets lost etc
a spare key
a spare tyre
a spare set of clothes
extra.translation[1].definitions[0].defi: in addition to the usual things or the usual amount
extra.translation[1].definitions[0].exam: They need to offer something extra to attract customers.
I got a few extra in case anyone else decides to come.
I’ll be making $400 extra a month.
extra.translation[1].definitions[1].defi: used to emphasize an adjective or adverb
extra.translation[1].definitions[1].exam: You’re going to have to work extra hard to pass the exam.
extra.translation[2].definitions[0].defi: an amount of something, especially money, in addition to the usual, basic, or necessary amount
extra.translation[2].definitions[0].exam: I earn extra for working on Sunday.
extra.translation[3].definitions[0].defi: something which is added to a basic product or service that improves it and often costs more
extra.translation[3].definitions[0].exam: Tinted windows and a sunroof are optional extras (=something that you can choose to have or not).
Be careful, there may be hidden extras (=additional charges which you are not told about).
It’s got lots of useful little extras.
extra.translation[3].definitions[1].defi: an actor in a film who does not say anything but is part of a crowd
extra.translation[3].definitions[1].exam: He started his acting career as an extra.
extra.translation[5].definitions[0].defi: more than normal, or in addition to something else
extra.translation[5].definitions[0].exam: We will be advertising for 200 extra staff.
an extra 1% on National Insurance contributions
extra.translation[6].definitions[0].defi: something which is added on, especially charges on a bill
extra.translation[6].definitions[0].exam: Cruise control is available as an optional extra.
Be clear about what you are paying for, as there may be hidden extras.
